Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
CAN: The student can attempt to draw two different habitats, although they may not clearly indicate one is land and one is water.
The student may include basic shapes or doodles representing plants and animals, but these are often indistinct or not specific to either habitat.
CANNOT: The student cannot clearly differentiate between land and water habitats in their drawing (student may mix elements of both in one habitat).
The student cannot consistently or accurately represent various types of plants specific to each habitat (e.g., may draw palm trees in water where fish should be).
The student is unlikely to illustrate different types of animals distinctly for each habitat, possibly placing land animals in water habitats or vice versa.
The student cannot show how different living things are specific to each type of habitat (student might place fish next to a tree).
The student does not illustrate patterns in the diversity of living things across the two habitats (no noticeable diversity shown).
